com.tcss543.networkflow

Class FordFulkerson

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tcss543.networkflow.FordFulkerson

  • public class FordFulkerson
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class FordFulkerson implements the Ford Fulkerson algorithm and returns the maximum flow. It returns the maximum flow in double format e.g. 23.0 If any error occurs like negative edge capacity or source/sink unreachable it returns -0.0 If source and sink node cannot be reached during initialization it returns 0.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Paranjit Singh

      • validateEdges

        private boolean validateEdges()
        Validates that edge capacity with negative value doesn't exist in the graph
        Returns:
        true, if all edges are positive, otherwise false

      • bfs

        private boolean bfs(int[] path)
        This method implements breadth first search algorithm and returns true if it finds a simple path from source to sink node. This method also updates the path it took to reach the sink node in the provided path array.
        Parameters:
        path - An array to update the simple path if found
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • findVertex

        private int findVertex(java.lang.String vertexName)
        This method finds the vertex with a provided vertex name.
        Parameters:
        vertexName - the vertex name
        Returns:
        the index of the node if found else -1

      • findEdge

        private int findEdge(com.tcss543.graphcode.Vertex startNode,
                     com.tcss543.graphcode.Vertex endNode)
        This method finds an edge between two provided vertex.
        Parameters:
        startNode - the start node
        endNode - the end node
        Returns:
        the index of the edge if found else -1

      • getAugmentingPath

        private int[] getAugmentingPath()
        This method finds the augmenting path in the flow of the Graph.
        Returns:
        the augmenting path if found else an empty array

      • augment

        private void augment(int[] path,
                     java.lang.Double bottleNeck)
        This method augments the given graph with the bottleneck. It reduces the value of the forward edge by bottleneck and adds/increases the value of reverse edge by bottleneck.
        Parameters:
        path - the simple path in the graph
        bottleNeck - the bottle neck to increase in the flow

      • getBottleNeck

        private double getBottleNeck(int[] path)
        This method finds the bottle neck in the graph's flow with the provided simple path.
        Parameters:
        path - the simple path in the graph
        Returns:
        the bottle neck

      • getMaxFlow

        public double getMaxFlow(com.tcss543.graphcode.SimpleGraph sg,
                         int sourceNodeIndex,
                         int sinkNodeIndex)
        Overloaded getMaxFlow method. Finds the max flow in the graph. This method takes the source and sink node indexes as parameter.
        Parameters:
        sg - the SimpleGraph
        sourceNodeIndex - the source node index
        sinkNodeIndex - the sink node index
        Returns:
        the max flow in double format e.g. 23.0 If any error occurs like negative edge capacity or source/sink unreachable it returns -0.0 If source and sink node cannot be reached during initialization it returns 0.0

      • getMaxFlow

        public double getMaxFlow(com.tcss543.graphcode.SimpleGraph sg,
                         java.lang.String sourceNodeName,
                         java.lang.String sinkNodeName)
        Overloaded getMaxFlow method. Finds the max flow in the graph. This method takes the source and sink node names as parameter.
        Parameters:
        sg - the SimpleGraph
        sourceNodeName - the source node name
        sinkNodeName - the sink node name
        Returns:
        the max flow in double format e.g. 23.0 If any error occurs like negative edge capacity or source/sink unreachable it returns -0.0 If source and sink node cannot be reached during initialization it returns 0.0

      • getMaxFlow

        public double getMaxFlow(com.tcss543.graphcode.SimpleGraph sg)
        Overloaded getMaxFlow method. Finds the max flow in the graph. This method uses the default source and sink node name.
        Parameters:
        sg - the SimpleGraph
        Returns:
        the max flow in double format e.g. 23.0 If any error occurs like negative edge capacity or source/sink unreachable it returns -0.0 If source and sink node cannot be reached during initialization it returns 0.0
